translated: Jātaka🔽The Collection of Birth Stories (Jātakas)🔽The Chapter of the Cock
The Birth Story of Aṭṭhisena (1)
“I don’t know these people,
Aṭṭhisena, the merchants.
They’ve come together and ask me for something,
but why don’t you ask me?”
“The beggar is disliked,
and the one who doesn’t give to the beggar is disliked.
That’s why I don’t ask you,
lest I be despised.”
“The one who lives by begging
and doesn’t beg at the right time
destroys the merit of others
and doesn’t even live himself.
But the one who lives by begging
and begs at the right time
obtains merit for others
and lives himself.
The wise don’t despise
seeing a beggar come.
You’re dear to me as a celibate.
Speak, what do you wish to say?”
“The wise don’t beg,
and the wise know that.
The noble ones stand for what’s intended,
this is the noble ones’ way of begging.”

original: “Dadāmi te brāhmaṇa rohiṇīnaṁ,🔽Gavaṁ sahassaṁ saha puṅgavena;
analyzed: dadāmi te brāhmaṇa rohiṇīna  gavam sahassam saha puṅgavena
translated: “I give you, brahmin, a thousand cows with a bull on top,

original: Ariyo hi ariyassa kathaṁ na dajjā,
analyzed: ariyaḥ hi ariyassa katham na dajjā
translated: for the noble ones should give to the noble ones.

analyzed: sutvāna gāthā tava dhamma yuttā ati
translated: and having heard your verses, which are in accordance with the Dhamma.”
The Birth Story of Aṭṭhisenaka (S87) is the eighth.
